I had there chicken tacos, pork tacos and there fried avocado taco. The first two are perfect but the fried avocado is a little bland.  Over all they have great service as well. I would definitely recommend them, especially on their Wednesday night special.
They charge for chips and salsa refills, and after a half hour of sitting down, we still have not ordered, ended up leaving.

This place used to be a favorite...even held a couple birthday dinners. Had dinner there tonight though after a hiatus and am sad to report its gone down hill.   They were out of children's menus (weird), they removed my husband's favorite Mexican pizzas from the menu, the chips were stale and the shrimp on the tacos tasted off. The corn was also way overcooked and unappetizing. They also got my order wrong and never brought out the beans I ordered my kids.   Fortunately we had a very nice waiter who was attentive and even comped meal. So disappointing though and will not be returning.
Mexican street corn is awesome and $2 for Tecate tall boys late night is where its at

Had a nice lunch here today. Fantastic blood orange margarita. I had Jamaican jerk tacos which were very tasty. My wife had the "maverick" lunch bowl, which she enjoyed. The only change she would have made was to have shredded beef instead of ground beef.   The waitstaff was fine. We enjoyed our lunch and the price was nice for lunch.
Dollar Tecates, 2 dollar tacos and 3 dollar margaritas? Consider this your new go to Wednesday spot.   Good service and quick to drink refills!

Stopped in for lunch, everything about it was on point. Had an old mech copper and two korean bbq tacos on hard corn shells. Was delicious. Good tacos cometimes give people a bit of sticker shock but they were priced in the same range as others of comperable quality. Will be returning.

Five stars for the food, and drinks. They have Tecate, which happens to be one of my favorite Mexican beers, and it's super cheap!  Two stars for the service. Poor guy either had to idea what he was doing, or he had too heavy of a load. Either way it took forever for us to get another beer, and of course the checks were messed up.   We will certainly return for more fish tacos!
Been here twice - once for lunch and then dinner. Both times great food. Tacos offer a variety of flavors. Wait staff friendly and quick. Casual atmosphere.

The good: unique, lively decor The bad: so far, all of the food. Went for lunch Friday with a friend. The wings were over cooked and lacked flavor. My friend gave the soup and salad 2 thumbs down.   In addition they make flour tortillas with a hint of corn, and the server claimed this was the authentic way. Never seen this in a South American restaurant operated by South Americans.  They make their chips the same way, and thus more closely resemble pita chips than tortilla chips.  No es bueno.  Near-average for American-Mexican food but needs work.

I have now visited Maverick 2 times. I am glad I went the second time, because they redeemed themselves somewhat when it came to service. The first time I went we were basically ignored after being seated. When I order by tacos I specifically asked for no onions as I was allergic, she then brought me a plate that obviously had onions on it. When I asked for a new order, she looked upset. The second was much better, our waitress was friendly and very attentive.  Really the thing that saves Maverick is the tacos. So much variety, so much flavor! The skirt steak taco is great, as is the pina colada taco. The Mexican Street Corn is also very good! I have tried both the White Sangria and the Margarita. The sangria was good, but the Margarita was very salty.  Overall, I gave 4 stars because I have enjoyed the food and service was much better the second time, but they definitely have some issues.

One of the best taco places in Charlotte, with great food, outstanding margaritas, and a really cool atmosphere. Only downside is the parking. We usually come early (we have small kids), but plan to park someone else on Montford Dr. and walk if you're coming after 8 p.m. Another small complaint is having to pay (!) for chips and salsa, but the tab is still pretty reasonable compared to other taquerias. All in all, a great place for tacos and tequila!

The food here was fabulous! I ordered a pineapple mojito, gringo beef tacos, and sweet potato waffle fries. All of it was incredible! Only reason for 4 instead of 5 stars is because we were told it'd be a 10 minute wait, but waited for 45. I don't mind waiting at any place, but be a little more open if it's gonna take longer.

I am disappointed to stay that they have changed their sangria.  I had previously wrote how they had the best sangria I have ever had in my life. I had pumped all my friends and boyfriend up about getting sangria and after a month, we finally made it.   The original sangria came filled with plump black berries and was made with basil which added the perfect twist to the sweetness.   However, this has all changed. No more plump black berries. No more basil. Their excuse was that basil is out of season.  I am pretty sure that you can still get a hold of it.  I think the real reason is that the person who created the menu has since left.  My bet is that the new chef thought he could cut corners without realizing the impact it had.

Nice clean place. Main entree was good - fried avocado taco and pulled pork taco   However the sides were disappointing. Pablano rice had no flavor and the black eyed peas were hard and served cold. Salsa was good but would be better if served warm or at least room temp.

Came in on a Wednesday night with 2 girlfriends and loved it. Quick service, dank food and good value.  $1 Tecate -yesss I had the Tequila Shrimp Taco and Mexican Street corn as a side (was too full of beer and chips to eat the chicken tinga)...   Definitely a casual spot I would frequent to get my street taco fix. Want to try the pineapple guac next time :p

I've been here a couple times. First visit I only had drinks.  Nothing serious.  Drinks were decent.  The most recent time I had a late lunch there and had the vegetarian taco entree.  The food was good enough. I mean I wasn't in love with it and could probably do a better job at home for cheaper, but it was decent.    No issues with the service. (The same server waited on me both times).  Why 3 stars? I expected a bit more from the food.
We have been here three times and have always left happy. Great place for cinco de mayo. The food is excellent everything we have had has been very good.
Ate there today and had one of the best chimichangas. I haven't had on in a while and it was delicious. And they just added this to the menu.

This place has a really cool look to it.  Mexican street food and great music.  They serve chips and salsa at the table; but charge $2 bucks after the first bucket.  Salsa was really good, but chips were room temperature and not remarkable.  Got the Mojo Pork Taco's and they were delicious.  My lovely fiancee got the Tequila shrimp tacos and that was even more delicious.  My side was the black beans, next time I want to get the Mexican street corn; heard the waitress describe to another table.  Service was good, nice joint we'll be back.

We liked this place... mostly because it was half priced fajitas night (Tuesdays)... I think if we had paid full price, this might not be a three star review.  The fajitas were really tasty, but not earth shattering. What WAS awesome was the roasted corn with their southwest chipotle dressing on it. I may have to eat corn on the cob that way at home! The cilantro rice was interesting and tasty too. Beans... not so much.  Someone mentioned below about the salsa and chips not being free after the first serving.. I have to agree that is a serious bad mark against the restaurant. Their salsa is one of the best I've had. I wanted more of it.. but no way was I going to pay for it. That's just crap. It costs them next to nothing for chips and salsa. Don't be so cheap with it.  My wife said the guacamole was very good.. I don't eat it so you have to take her word for it.  In summary, go there on Tuesday nights for half price fajitas. It's well worth it just for that.

What makes this place cooler than the other bars in town? The outdoor seating area! And I don't mean just ANY outdoor space, this is a fenced in area, with colorful christmas lights adorning the top of the patio, with brand new wooden high picnic table and benches. 3 Large flat screen TVs are on the outside patio, so you will not miss a second of the game you came here to watch. It is a magnificent experience after the sun cools off and enjoy yourself on the patio with good company. Great for conversations as it is much quieter outside. The sound of the TVs are muted so you can enjoy your company at the same time.  Try any of their chips and dip and you will not be disappointed. The avocado dip is awesome, the avocado is very fresh. The Queso dip is also banging, not too salty or hot.  I wouldn't come back here for tacos, if I wanted taco I will probably go to Cabo Fish Taco in Noda. Their Tacos were OK.   The drinks were quite fantastic, we ordered red sangrias to share. There were chunks of strawberries in the sangria. It was just the right flavor, sweet but not to sweet, you can taste the alcohol, and the drink was refreshing.   The turn-around for our orders was really fast. We also really appreciated that all of our items were served in a nice presentation, which you can not expect at most bars.

Live music!  The band was really good!  A good bluesy cover band.  The lead singer had a great voice & played a mean harmonica.  The servers were nice & they even put on a ball game we wanted to see.  Nice big tv's.  Queso & chips were really good & they salsa that comes with the complimentary chips is nice & smoky, not too spicy.  Just went for the music & some drinks, so didn't try anything else.  I'd go back.

I was really excited to try this place but was a little disappointed. The service was kinda slow but the waiter was nice as could be. Tacos had a good flavor but weren't served very hot. Same for the street corn it had great flavor and a unique sauce but was kind of cold when I got it. Salsa was delicious and on the mild side.

My husband and I were regular's here.  The last couple of times were terrible.  The first time it was bad we chalked it up to a fluke.  After the 2nd we won't be returning.  Everything was cold.  The queso needed a spoon, cold.  I ordered the tortilla soup, COLD.  I will admit that the waitress was awesome.  She understood I was unhappy and made every attempt to fix it.  Even explained that they had a new chef.    Nope. No more!

I can only base this review on service and not on food because we never got to that part. My roommate and I waited a solid 10 minutes before even seeing a menu that she had to go get from the host/register area near the door because no one brought us any. It was maybe a little busier than it could have been, but when someone walks in you make sure to bring them a menu or at least check in with them and tell them it's going to be a couple of minutes before you could get to them. There seem to be a big deal going on about the drinking age and the daily $1 beer special and I just wanted some tacos for dinner. When I finally got a menu I picked the Tequila shrimp tacos and never actually got to order them. We had then been there roughly 25 minutes and no one came and checked to see if we wanted food/drinks. A waitress did manage to bring me some water. We left once we saw we were never really going to get served. It was a disappointing first time. Maybe I'll consider coming back during the day...
The cowboy tacos are fantastic, the service impeccable, the decor different but cool and the ambiance was comfortable and really nice. Professional staff and great food!

Decided to try this for lunch.  The Jerk Chicken soft taco was delicious and my mexican street corn was super sweet and tasty  :-)  I enjoyed the salsa but wasn't thrilled with the thick salty chips, they seemed store bought to me.  The sweet tea was perfect, the decor was busy but clean and the restrooms were well stocked which I appreciate.  It wasn't the most amazing mexican food, but it was tasty enough that I would return for another lunch.
Salsa here is delicious and fresh! Parking lot is small but you can easily find a space on the road. I've always tried their combo tacos. They are each unique. Sangria is good too!

Ate dinner here tonight with wifey. I'm on the fence about this place, because I can't say anything good and I can't say anything bad. We went on a recommendation from a friend that told us about the Wednesday happy hour specials. The special was 2.00 tacos (chicken) and 3.00 Margaritas. Being wifey doesn't eat meat she got 2 avocado tacos (3.50 ea) and  ended up getting 2 margaritas. I got 4 chicken tacos and 1 margarita. Wifey really liked her tacos, my were OK nothing to write home about but how can you complain at 2.00. The margarita were also just OK but they were also just 3.00. I will not be rushing back here for the happy hour specials but I will go back.

I didn't give this restaurant five stars because I think there are better Tex-Mex places elsewhere in Charlotte. However, I implore you to try the Acupulco Cobb salad with the grilled Mahi Mahi. The seafood was fantastic and the portions are very generous.   The wait staff is kind. My husband and I really enjoyed the atmosphere as well. It has an eclectic vibe between punk and Texas. The chips and salsa are good but nothing out of this world.

Hidden gem.   Good service on a Saturday night, very lively place for a holiday weekend.  Taco's were excellent!   I recommend a variety and get a good taste of few off the menu.  As others have mentioned, the corn is a must as the side.

I go here once a week.  Staff have always been awesome.  Ive had mistakes happen (which is going to happen) and the service recovery has been excellent.  I always get a quesadilla with grilled chicken.  (it did suck when they started upcharging $1.50 just for grilling chicken) Otherwise, everyone is terrific and the food is right on.  Def give it a try if you haven't.  Oh! and in and out in under 30 minutes!

Tacos and rock n roll! This is one of those reviews that I am pumped to finally be able to update. Why? Because I'm adding a star!  Four of us walked over here for lunch after bowling across the street. We started with queso because every Saturday should start with queso. I ordered went with a two taco meal, one jalapeno mahi mahi and one tequila shrimp. Both were good, but the shrimp was my favorite. I love the Mexican street corn. I always get it. They do have some vegetarian options, including falafel, fried avocado, and roasted cauliflower tacos. I'm not vegetarian, but I would order all three of those because they sound delicious.   This place has a great lunch menu on week days. The meals come with a drink and the most expensive thing on the list is $8. Such a great deal. They also have pretty good drink specials throughout the week.  My only problem with this place has been service. I still think there's a little issue there, but I think it is better.

Great customer service. A unique twist in Mexican food. I ordered the pork belly, Korean and steak tacos. All the food came out piping hot and the drinks specials added the this experience. I came with a party of five and all of our food came out fast considering they were packed. Would recommend to anyone wanted a cool Mexican thats a class of its own.

We went to maverick rock taco today for the first time and this will be our last time. We came in and they only had two tables in the whole restaurant.  We were excited to try it and we ordered 4 tacos.  After waiting for 30 mins for our food I got up and asked our server.  She apologized and said food was almost ready.  After 5 more minutes the food came to our table and was cold.  We weren't going to eat cold food so we left and will not be back.

The bartender (Stephen) is the nicest guy! He needs the bartender of the year award!! Every drink he made for us was on point. The pineapple mojito was my favorite until he presented a blackberry mojito, which is probably the best thing I've ever tasted. I haven't tried the food yet but the menu looks bangin. I'll be back tomorrow for sure !

LOVE these guys!!  One of the managers, John, was INCREDIBLE in helping me surprise one of the guys on my team and his mother with drinks and apps.  He helped me set up this whole surprise, kept me posted on the phone and then texted several times to make sure it was done correctly.  What incredible service to help pull off such an awesome surprise.  Thank you, John, for going WAY above the call of duty!!

Damn I love this place. MRT is one of my favorite places on Montford. After being here a handful of times, a review is a must. I always start with the queso because, well, its queso. Then my go to is always 2 tacos with a side. Do yourself a favor and go with the barbacoa short rib taco. The meat is flavorful and the drizzle of jalapeno crema sets it right. The crispy pork belly is another go to of mine. Pretty simple taco that lets the pork belly speak for itself. While at first I was thinking the taco needed a little something, I wouldn't want to dull down the flavors it has now - good job MRT for keeping it simple and sweet. As for sides, I have to admit I've never ventured away from my two favorites - the mexican street corn and the sweet potato waffle fries. Now, I guarantee their other sides are something to talk about, but why mess with a good thing. I mean, come on, mexican street corn is roasted corn topped with queso. WITH QUESO!   Other than that, the atmosphere is laid back and during warm nights the staff will pop up the garage door for fresh air. As we all know, parking can be tricky but that's what you get on Montford. Tasty margaritas as well and a decent bar menu that pretty much is the same beers anywhere you head on Montford. But seeing how I usually head here for dinner then hop to Angry Ale's for drinks, the beer list doesn't bother me. All in all, a solid place and definitely somewhere I'll be back to.

What I like about Maverick Rock Taco is that it's in a really cool area and it has a laid back vibe that serves really good food.  I ordered the Fish taco special for that night and I was over joined that they accomodated my request to not have a tortialla and brought it to me "naked".  The Mahi Mahi was delish and the quac was great!  The restaurant was clearly busy and you could tell that it's a popular place!  My only thing was that they brought out my white wine in a semi-dirty glass and it was room temp...say 70 degrees room temp.  :-( Oh well...I drank it and it still tasted good but just don't like warm white wine.    This will be a frequent place for sure for a quick casual bite during the week or a place to hang with friends!

I would say this is more of a taco place than a full authentic mexican restaurant. We went for dinner and service was ok, it seemed we had 4 different people so sometimes was hard to get someone...maybe because the table was in the bar area. I liked they had so many unique tacos to choose from. I got one with shredded beef and it was amazing! I also got the pork belly and wAsnt a fan...I like pork belly and it was rubbery and even though normally fatty there was pretty much no meat. Cheese dip was good and the Mexican corn was awesome, that is a must if you are eating here. Their sangria they made was pretty good too. Will return to try more.

The other reviews are spot on. Sunday evening (about 6PM) Dawn and myself discovered Maverick Rock Taco by accident: we just happened to spot it while looking for something new. We were seated in the bar area and promptly attended to by the bartender/ server for the table. He was very knowledgeable about the menu and made some excellent suggestions.  We had the salsa trio app (tomatillo/ avacado, Roja and mango/ habenero). The tomatilo/ avacado was exceptional. The Roja was a bit more bland than I like, but a dash of hot sauce opened up the flavor. There was no 'heat' to the sweet/heat of the mango/ habenaro ... perhaps the spice was left out of this batch? For our entree we ordered six different proteins with a variety of toppings as tacos (chicken, steak, calamari, shrimp, vegetarian) IMPOSSIBLE to pick a favorite because they were all great: fresh, tasty and HUGE portions for the money.  The only drawback (and it's a pretty big one) was the atmosphere on this particular evening. We were seated in the bar area (We weren't told there was another dining area, just seated in the bar.) and had just received our food when a young woman decided to pay the jukebox. The music blasted out a hip hop song full of profanity and explicit sexual content. The music was loud enough to restrict conversation. There was a table of young twenty somethings seated behind us and they were singing along at the top of their lungs. Yike. Remember, this is about 6PM on a Sunday night. A server told us later that they had been there since opening and drinking all day. That experience really threw a wet towel over the evening.   We'll be back, but only during lunch next time.

I wanted to like this place. Service was good, I had the jalapeño margarita and it was good, but the food was just awful. I had the surf and turf. The mahi mahi  in the one taco definitely was not fresh, tasted really off, I took one bite and left it. The shrimp in the other taco was overly sweet. And the short rib enchiladas, which sounded so awesome, were cold and underwhelming. I don't think I will be back, unless it is only for drinks.
I enjoyed my experience here! The food was very good.  I had a few drinks which were also tasty and unique. The service was good and fast! I would go back for sure.

Friday night was my 1st trip here. I'll be honest, it didn't start out well. There were open tables all over the restaurant and multiple groups standing at the door and the hostesses were not exactly in a hurry to get anyone sat. They kept walking back and forth from the host stand not really doing anything. If there ever was a reason to use words like "mosey" or "aloof", these girls would be it.  The wait staff was super nice so that kind of made up for it. The food was very good and they weren't stingy with my margarita, although my friend ordered a beer and the glass wasn't filled to the top.  Long and short, The food was worth giving it a second chance on a week night.

This is my favorite taco spot in all of Charlotte! Since moving here, I have been on a quest to find amazing tacos, and rock taco hits the spot. I've been here numerous occasions and have never been disappointed. Some personal favorites are the Korean BBQ taco, tequila shrimp, chicken tinga, short rib and mahi mahi taco. I'm big on fish tacos and all their fish is fresh and not greasy after it's fried. Their spicy cilantro fries are delish, and the Mexican street corn is always a winner! Overall, it's a great little taco spot in Montfort that I can't recommend enough!

We LOVE Tacos at this spot!  Their menu is awesome!!!!!  I got the falafel taco, skirt steak taco, & tequila shrimp taco.  All were so amazing!  My husband got the fried avocado, which was just ok.  But his fried fish taco was delish!  One must get item is the Mexican corn on the cob, it will seriously melt in your mouth.  And if you are up for drinks they have so many margarita choices to pick from.  As for chips & salsa, make sure to ask for the spicer salsa and also the salsa verde (they garnish it with a small scoop of guac...needless to say we devoured it all.  Next to Cabo Fish Taco this place is on par and up there with it, can't wait for our next dinner trip there!!!

Maverick Taco is overall a great spot for a quick lunch. I've only been here for lunch -- and, always order the Maverick bowl. Shrimp isn't listed as one of the protein options but you can add it to the bowl. The service is great, food is always quick. Lunch special prices are very affordable.

I'm a fan of this place! A group of us went here for dinner recently and all had a great time. The service was perfect - our waiter checked in with us often, but didn't hover around. We ordered different types of sangrias and every enjoyed theirs. Chips and salsa were decent - not out of this world good but tasty enough. I tried to season the chips with salt but our salt shaker was empty.   I ordered two tacos - tequila shrimp and buffalo shrimp, along with Mexican street corn. Last time we came, my boyfriend got the street corn and said "we can share it!" I had one small bite and the next thing I know, he had eaten the whole thing! I ordered my own this time and it was good. The sauce needed spread around the whole corn but that was easy enough to do. My boyfriend got the Texan taco, pork belly taco and Mexican street corn. He enjoyed his but said he didn't like the sauce on the pork belly and will next time ask for the taco without the sauce. Our friends ordered the fajitas (along with the street corn) and liked it a lot.   Good service. Good drinks. Good food. We will be back.
The Mexican street food is outta bounds

It really was a pretty nice place, and I would give it an extra half star if that were available. I think the beer is a little pricey, but they had a pretty good selection of tap beers. Food seems okay, some of it quite tasty, but nothing special that I would rave about. Service was good and Unlike what somebody else said, the chips and salsa were free for the first basket anyway and I think they were better than your average Mex. restaurant chips and salsa.

I really don't have much to say about this place. I've been here 3 times before actually reviewing. Their patio is cool but the food is "blah." If you're here to drink, awesome. If you're hungry and looking for some killer Tex-mex, you're better off going somewhere else in CLT.

One of the better Mexican places I've been in Charlotte. The atmosphere was great and our waitress was very attentive.   We started with a $3 margarita on special and the jalapeño margarita. The $3 one was ok, but the jalapeño margarita was excellent.  There was fresh, muddled jalapeños in the bottom of the glass. Spicy and delicious. We also had their guacamole, which was the best guacamole I've had in Charlotte yet. The salsa for the table was also great.   My boyfriend ordered the cauliflower taco and avocado taco with a side of plantains. They were both great, with the cauliflower being the favorite.   I ordered the short rib taco and the ahi tuna taco with Mexican street corn. Both were great with the short rib as the winner.   My only beef: the plantains and my short rib taco were cold. We had to ask for another of both. The replacements were waaaay better and quite good actually. I just wish that had happened the first time.   Great hangout and good good. I'll go back.

9 out of 10 times, yelp gets it right, in my opinion. this was the one time they got it wrong! when i looked up reviews for Maverick, it had a 3 star rating, and I was almost sure I didn't want to eat here... but am I glad that my hubby convinced me otherwise. The ambiance - so lively! on a Thursday night it was busy. mostly with bigger groups of 7-10 people. The ceiling is full of colorful lights, the music plays loud, and there's a digital JukeBox with the latest and greatest hits to take your pick from! Moving on to the drinks.. they have some neat drink specials, but I went with the Michelada. It was one of the best I've had till date. I got to try the chicken fajitas, which were somewhat non traditional. The dish doesn't come with the usual sides of lettuce, salsa, guac and sour cream.. instead there's a side of delicious charro beans, pablano green rice & Mexican street corn! I also tried some of the jalapeno mahi mahi tacos with a side of the spicy cilantro lime fries. a random interesting thing I noticed - they list all their vendors on the menu, that way, you know that your food is made from fresh produce and meats. I almost forgot to mention the friendly staff! Overall, it was a great experience, and I'm going back :)

The pork at this place is the best, I love love love it... soooo good. The chicken is good, steak and beef were a little dry the few times I had. Brother had a salad and it was lacking in the meat department. The corn is really good, beans excellent as well.

Great food and great specials on 1-2-3 night. Margaritas were delicious but hard to drink more than one because the mix was too sour. Asked the waiter several times to turn the music down so we could converse at our table but he never did, not sure if that was his fault or restaurant policy but eventually had to move to the back of the restaurant to be able to carry on a conversation. Otherwise the service wasn't bad. Would go back here but not my #1 montford spot.

Visited this place with friends for Cinco de Mayo.  Understandably very crowded, so we waited at the bar.  I had the Maverick margarita, which tasted like a margarita should.  The bartender appeared to be a bit juvenile....I don't know if he thought he was flirting, but my girl friend stated that his banter may work on twenty something's, but not on women of our age.  Besides the bartender, there were two donkeys outside, dressed in tiny sombreros!  The donkeys were sweet and didn't try to unsuccessfully flirt with us.  Anyway, we were seated in under an hour, and, while we waited, we had chips and salsa.  Very average, but having something to snack on was great!  The bar area had a band and was noisy in general, so we were delighted to sit in the back area.  I liked that the menu designated the vegetarian items.  I ordered a dish that sounded so decadent:  three cheese quesadillas with spinach and portabello mushrooms, sour cream and quacamole.  They also came with a garnish of cabbage and tomatoes.  The quesadillas did not taste as special as they sounded.  In fact, one could not have picked them out of a dive bar quesadilla lineup.  Also, I had to ask our waitress for a glass of water three times.  Good thing I wasn't in the desert. About the decor......the walls featured pictures of rock musicians, such as Jimmy Page, Ozzy and Peter Frampton.  But, the music did not match the theme.  The genre was basically pop music of today, with a surprise song by Journey thrown in (oooooh, that was heavy!).  One detail that caught the eye of myself and my rocker chick friend was a stencil near the bathrooms that said, "you are never too old to rock."  Photo op for us aging head bangers!  So the outdoor donkeys and the stenciling saved the day!

Was headed to Duckworths but they were overcrowded and very loud.  Saw Mavericks and decided to give it a try.  Best thing I did today.  Both the Chicken Tinga taco and the Chorizo tacos are outstanding.

Bring back the fajita pizza! :) We used to come exclusively for this entree but sadly it's no longer on the menu. It's too bad that only a few people knew about it.  I'm not really sure why Maverick doesn't draw larger crowds. Chips and salsa are great, service has always been good, the pizza used to be one of my favorite dishes in Charlotte, atmosphere is fun (would be better with a larger crowd).. but I haven't been on a night where it was packed.   I've had not so stellar experiences like some of the recent posts but if you're a regular anywhere it's likely to happen at some point, and that's not the norm here. This is a great option for casual dining at a reasonable price and is definitely worth a visit.

We have been here several times and love the food.  Especially the tacos and quesadillas.  Our favorite bartenders are Ciara and Sam.  We always get great service and would highly recommend this place to everyone.

So, some friends and I decided to stop in tonight & overall everything was ok...again. Our service was great, almost a little too much. Our waitress was at our table every second, somewhat too much. We enjoyed fajitas, steak tacos, and chicken tacos. The salsa and chips were good, but we got charged for a refill, really? And, two of us ordered a side of sour cream, for our fajitas, and were charged $1.50 for each. Ridiculous! I really wanted to give them a four, but right now I am just not ready, everything stick ok.

Another seemingly dead spot for restaurant in Charlotte. But this time i think it is more than just bad fengshui.  When everyone else is hopping on a Saturday night, no reason this place should be as empty as it was... Unless the reason is subpar service and even worse food.    The space is cute, I love the dimly lit by color string light atmosphere in the bar area.  We were greeted at the door by the DJ (didn't know they use the hostess stand as DJ booth until we were on the way out). We sat at the bar where it was virtually empty. Somehow it took the 2 bartenders a good while to acknowledge us. One was too busy closing out or something, which left the only other one to do the serving. She didn't have answers for any questions I had regarding drink special or food menu.   I don't even recall what we had, since I wasn't the one needing to eat. I do remember the calamari being the chewiest batch I have ever had. EVER! And I eat lots of calamari. I am sure there is a very simple basic way of prepping them in order for them to not be chewy. When the best things I got was chips and salsa and I am sure they weren't even homemade, it may spell the end of a tex-mex restaurant.

Enjoyed my tacos. Chips were good. Roja salsa was good.  A little quiet when we arrived, we were the only occupied table in the dining area. I probably should have moved to the bar area that seemed a bit busier, but what the heck.  $3 draft Dos Equis Amber went down nicely while we chomped on chips (and GREAT "Roja" salsa) and reviewed the menu.  My daughter opted for the gringo Mexican pizza but I'm sad to say that she didn't particularly enjoy it. It's huge but it just wasn't great. She only ate about a quarter of it.  On the other side of the table, I opted for tacos. I mean, it's in THE NAME. So I got a plate of two tacos. Number one that was the Jamaican chicken. Excellent with some spicy jerk chicken and sweet fried plaintains on there. Yum! And the number two was the Chickpea Felafel. Absolutely excellent with cucumbers and pickled oions and Greek yogurt. Both were very tasty and delish. For my side, I chose the "Spicy cilantro lime fries." Tasty but not really all that spicy but the cilantro was sprinkled on top and the lime squeezed in there too. I definitely made out better here.  Several televisions tuned into the sporting events of the moment. Service was decent, even if we were the only folks at a table in the back area. Food took a bit, but fresh food cooked to order is gonna do that. No complaints.  Good vibe, good food, good service. It's good. I'm a fan!

I wasn't expecting a whole lot here. Food is okay. I got the avocado tacos with lettuce wraps instead of tortillas and they were nothing to write home about. Maybe a bit over filled, so they were hard to eat.  Had a boring queso fundido skillet (vegetarian), and the cheese didn't even seem fully melted. Disappointing. Served with soft flour tortillas. Meh.  The one highlight for me was the house margarita. Simple and delicious. I slurped up the whole thing.  Ultimately, I can't say that you should come here, but if you do, prepare for an underwhelming experience.

Where do I even start.. Alright. I typically like to give people the benefit of the doubt when it comes to having a bad day.. but our server Chuck was the absolute worst.  My boyfriend and I decided to go out to eat. Typically we get two rounds of chips. When we asked for more chips with the queso, he gave us an attitude and acted like he had to do way too much work. I ordered the steak burrito and my boyfriend ordered the chicken tinga burrito. My burrito was as bland as putting three pieces of chalk in my mouth and my boyfriend said his burrito was just okay..Far from anything to write home about. Our drinks were never refilled and we were never checked up on. He came to clear out plates and didn't get us a check for the next 20 minutes. I showed my app for the free queso that was advertised after he brought the check and his eyes couldn't have rolled back any further into his head. And if they did, they'd get stuck for life. We finally spoke with the assistant GM and he was very apologetic and invited us back. First impressions are everything and this really killed it for me. I heard so many great things about this place but he ruined it. Chuck, I really hope you learn some great customer service skills and you're lucky you even got a 15% tip from us because even that was a stretch for us. I may be back but I will request that we don't get him as a server. Sorry, but not sorry.

Ok, so as we were waiting on an hour and half time for a lane at the bowing alley on Sat night on Montford we decided to try MRT. Menu looks good, place had a good crowd and it wasn't raining for once, so there were people sitting outside.  The waitress seated us promptly and the server came by for drink orders. We order chips and salsa, beers etc then our dinner. Food came reasonably quick was good but we had to ask for silverware and noticed a couple of other tables had to ask also. (Shouldn't the server notice that and bring it before we are server?). Overall the food was OK, not as good as Cantina or even Pacos Tacos but ok. What really surprised me was that the menu says the chips and salsa are $2 but they didn't charge us so I wonder if its free if you order food etc..The place was loud and the décor is nothing to write home about but overall it was Ok.

OUT OF THIS WORLD GOOD!!  So many options - So many Tacos!! And you can order all different kinds - as in singles - plus they are so little ordering 2 or 3 encouraged : )  The cilantro french fries are the best in town. The Mexican corn is good too, but spicy.  Best Tip about this place: They have outdoor seating, they have roll-up garage style windows if it's nice out.   *Side note, be sure to check out the bathrooms.

Excellent inventive tacos, I haven't had anything that wasn't very good here.  The Mexican street corn is wonderful, the pitchers of copper are a good price. Their pitchers suck however (from a physics standpoint) and will spill easily half a beer or more on the floor no matter how you or the waitstaff pours. After many a beer lost we found out there are a limited number of lids that fix the problem completely, ask for one.  Service has been either excellent or mediocre. (After we were told "It's okay, it was all foam anyways" while our waitress poured a good pint of copper on the floor while we shed a tear, unfamiliar with the specials we knew existed, Versus our skilled unflappable waitress who made sure we didn't spill on ourselves and handled a group of twenty voracious consumers of food and drink on her lonesome with constantly refilling pitchers, chips, drinks, water, salsa, etc etc.)  Edit: Since I bashed another taco place for not having it, praise for Maverick for offering free very good chips and very good salsa! Appreciated!
Awesome food. The nachos were very gourd and the chicken burrito with the waffle sweet potatoes were to die for. Definitely worth a return trip.

Mixed bag.  Habanero poppers were excellent if you don't mind a bit of heat.  My  mixed fish tacos were really tasty.   Mrs. S's "Mexican Caesar Salad" was absolute crap.  Just kind of barely there.  Stopped in the gent's room.... mistake.  I noted upon entry that another male occupied the restroom.  I vaguely made out is shadow and I called out a cheery "hello in there".   Message the Rock Taco management if you are checking reviews:  It is never under any circumstances appropriate to light your gent's rooms with 70s era blacklights.  No. No. No. No. No. No. No. No. No. No.     Not cool dudes,  not cool.

I am going to make this simple. Flauta's, Blood Orange Margarita, Fried Avocado taco's. I can not have a combo like that anywhere else in Charlotte! For that reason alone I digress, this is my most simply stated review as of yet.

I have to admit, when Montford Drive was getting trendy, I was becoming less and less interested.  Mostly because of the pain it was to get over there and then the extra pain it was to find parking etc.  I must be getting older, but just having to deal with that doesn't really strike my fancy, but I digress.  Came here in a whim (mostly because Sir Edmond Halley's didn't open until 5pm on Sundays).  But no expectations and a hungry stomach.  I was pleasantly surprised.  The place was not crowded at all since it was 3pm on a Sunday.  There were some folks enjoying the weather on the nice patio they have here (fake turf and colorful lawn chairs made it look like those folks were having a grand time).  We were seated right away, and I could tell our hostess/server was the only one working (luckily we weren't in a terrible rush).  I got $5 bloody mary drink special and waited for our friend to arrive.  Chips and salsa were brought out right away so we had plenty to much on.    After our friend arrived, we tried to put in our order, but our server was so busy at this point.  There was a good little while before she came back to our table.  The manager came by and we asked to put our order in and she sent someone else (food runner) to take our order while  our server caught up.  No biggie.  I had the Jalapeno Mahi Mahi tacos and cilantro lime fries.  I was starving by the time the food came so I inhaled it in 30seconds... It was pretty tasty and satisfying.  I'll definitely come back to try the other tacos on the menu - they looked pretty interesting.

Finally got to try this place. I had never been in this building in any of its incarnations and was surprised at how big it was inside.  What I found odd is the separation between the bar area and the dining room which seemed like a mile between the two.  Anyway, I sat in the bar area because that's usually where the best service is and I was not disappointed.  The bartender was great at explaining the menu and beer selection.  For beers, they have a few on tap and then the rest seem to be in cans instead of bottled.  That might be done to save on space.  The menu is very diverse with several interesting taco selections.   One interesting idea was a calamari taco.  I would never order that since I don't like calamari but it was pointed out to me.  Instead, I ordered ala carte with a adobo chicken taco, a chorizo taco and a size of the mango jicama slaw.  The tacos were presented well and looked appetizing but they only flavor I got was from the corn tortilla and the sauce on both tacos.  When i think of mexican or tex mex, I think of bold flavors and there were none here.  The best flavor I got was from the mango jicama salsa which is a nice and fresh change from the typical beans and rice.    Another think I was I was slightly disappointed with is that there were no free chips and salsa like most restaurants of this type.  Bummer.    Anyway, I can't say my experience was bad.  The food was certainly edible and it was still 2 times better than the experience I had at a local mexican place last week.  So maybe I need to give MRT another shot and try something else off the menu.

A three star means I would try it again, but I can't say that I would. Mavericks has a rustic bar atmosphere with lots of TVs. Service was fine. The menu was very interesting and I chose the chicken tacos and fried avocado tacos (neat idea). I also had the white queso.   The queso was basically just cheese. It seems they could spunk it up with jalapeños or something. The tacos were ok, but they were served lukewarm. Even the black beans I chose for a side were not hot.    My friend said they had been there before and liked it, but I wouldn't risk taking a friend or meeting someone for a lunch appointment.
Tacos were decent, kinda pricey. Good live music from Wicked Powers and cheap beers on Friday night had me in a great mood!

We love this place! The bartenders are the best and the Mexican pizzas are great! Ciara and Sam are so attentive and make awesome drinks. We always feel like we are VIPs when we come here and plan to return again many times.

My friend recommended this place and I couldn't thank her enough. Good drinks and good tacos. We ate outside and got to choose where we sat. It was the perfect time in spring to be out there. Great waiter with fast service. Very accommodating to my substitutions. Awesome. I need to go back.

Stopped in here on a Friday night and was surprised to see that it wasn't that busy.  Our party of 4 was seated right away.  We started with some beers, chips and salsa, and some queso and chorizo dip.  All were good but pretty standard for a tex-mex restaurant.  I got two tacos (Carnitas and Chorizo) and the street corn that people have raved about. Carnitas - I enjoyed the fruit elements (pineapple and mango).  They paired well with the pulled pork.  The crispy onions were an interesting topping.  While I enjoyed them, I'm not sure what they added to the taco. Chorizo - Nothing not to like here.  This felt very traditional and was delicious. Street Corn - Honestly, I didn't love it.  Cheese and sour cream on corn.  I was wanting the crema to have more flavor.  Garlic, salt, some chili perhaps.  Naturally, I ate it all so it wasn't terrible.  Our server took really good care of us and was patient as we took forever to look over the menu.  The restaurant has a funky vibe inside and is basically split with the bar on one side, the kitchen in the middle, and restaurant seating on the other side.
